arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm A: Subjects with normal renal function
arm_group.description: Asunaprevir 100 mg tablet by mouth twice daily for 7 days

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm B: Subjects with end stage renal disease
arm_group.description: Asunaprevir 100 mg tablet by mouth twice daily for 7 days

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm C: Subjects with mild renal impairment
arm_group.description: Asunaprevir 100 mg tablet by mouth twice daily for 7 days

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm D: Subjects with moderate renal impairment
arm_group.description: Asunaprevir 100 mg tablet by mouth twice daily for 7 days

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm E: Subjects with severe renal impairment
arm_group.description: Asunaprevir 100 mg tablet by mouth twice daily for 7 days

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to determine how Asunaprevir is handled by the body of subjects
      with kidney disease compared with subjects with normal kidney function

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Pharmacokinetics and Safety of Asunaprevir in Patients With Kidney Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary Purpose:

      Other: The purpose of the study is to determine how Asunaprevir is handled by the body of
      subjects with kidney disease compared with subjects with normal kidney function

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Group A: Subjects with normal renal function

          -  Group B: Patients with end stage renal disease

          -  Group C: Patients with mild renal impairment

          -  Group D: Patients with moderate renal impairment

          -  Group E: Patients with severe renal impairment

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  History of uncontrolled or unstable cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic,
             gastrointestinal, endocrine, hematopoietic, psychiatric and/or neurological disease

          -  Hepatitis B or C

          -  Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)

          -  Recent gastrointestinal disease

arm_group_label: Arm A: Subjects with normal renal function
Arm B: Subjects with end stage renal disease
Arm C: Subjects with mild renal impairment
Arm D: Subjects with moderate renal impairment
Arm E: Subjects with severe renal impairment

facility.name: New Orleans Center For Clinical Research

clinical_study.official_title: Open-Label, Parallel Group, Multiple-Dose Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics and Safety of Asunaprevir in Subjects With Renal Function Impairment

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve in one dosing interval [AUC(TAU)] will be calculated from the blood drug concentration versus time curve
primary_outcome.measure: AUC(TAU) of Asunaprevir assessed using plasma concentrations on Day 7

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma protein binding (PB) of Asunaprevir will be determined from the 1 hour and 3 hour time points post-dose

secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters will be derived from plasma concentration versus time and urinary excretion data (not applicable for subjects who are anuric)
secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) of Asunaprevir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 time points up to Day 10 (blood) and 3 time points up to Day 7 (urine)

secondary_outcome.description: PK parameters will be derived from plasma concentration versus time and urinary excretion data (not applicable for subjects who are anuric)
secondary_outcome.measure: Unbound Maximum observed plasma concentrations (Cmaxu) of Asunaprevir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 time points up to Day 10 (blood) and 3 time points up to Day 7 (urine)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax) of Asunaprevir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 time points up to Day 10 (blood) and 3 time points up to Day 7 (urine)

secondary_outcome.measure: Accumulation index (AI): Ratio of AUC(TAU) on Day 7 to AUC(TAU) on Day 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 22 (blood) and 3 (urine) time points on Days 1 and 7

secondary_outcome.description: All recorded adverse events (AEs) will be listed and tabulated by system organ class, preferred term and renal function group. Vital signs and clinical laboratory test results will be listed and summarized by renal function group and time. Any significant physical examination findings and clinical laboratory results will be listed. Electrocardiogram (ECG) readings will be evaluated by the investigator and abnormalities, if present, will be listed
secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability endpoints include all AEs and serious AEs, clinical laboratory tests, ECGs, vital signs and physical examination results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 and until 30 days post discontinuation of dosing

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
